title: Man Died 3 Days After COVID-19 Vaccine—Gov. Compensates Wife & 4 Children

opengraph.description:
Another person in Japan died after receiving a COVID-19 vaccine, and one year after the man’s wife applied for compensation after his death, the Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare granted a lump sum payment to this surviving wife. Shotaro Suda, age 36, who ran a liquor store in Taiwa, Miyagi Prefecture  died October 2021, just three days after receiving his second COVID-19 vaccine jab. The man had no pre-existing health problems and had an annual checkup with no problems reported. His wife, 35-year-old Mutsuko filed for COVID-19 vaccine-related compensation associated with her husband’s death via the prefectural government. Mainstream media, unlike in the United States, is covering such egregious injuries. A major news organization confirmed that Mutsuko Suda, who was pregnant with their fourth child when her husband died, would be compensated via the Taiwa Municipal Government, about 380 kilometers north of Tokyo.
Yet another Japanese death case, Ms. Suda went on the record for other loved ones that have lost their spouses and family members due to the COVID-19 vaccination drive:
